Pre-Game Insights: Despite Mauritania's commendable Africa Cup of Nations showing, Abdou has been unable to secure positive results either side of the continental tournament.
The Lions of Chinguetti advanced from the competition's group stage for the first time in the nation's history, having defeated 2019 champions Algeria 1-0 in their final group game.
Mauritania's last three competitive or non-competitive fixtures have resulted in losses, including a goalless draw with Morocco in March.
Senegal conceded a late equaliser against Congo DR and are seeking a seventh straight home triumph in World Cup qualifying.

Aliou Cisse's men were without Sadio Mane against Sebastian Desabre's troops but could and should have notched the points in Diamniadio if Nicolas Jackson converted his chance to double the home side's advantage.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mauritania has picked one point from an available nine in World Cup qualifying.
Senegal faces an opponent still reeling from the concession of a late equaliser against Congo DR.
The Lions of Teranga's results leave Senegal in second spot, two points behind surprise leaders Sudan.
Mauritania's last win in World Cup qualifying came against Cape Verde at AFCON 2023.
Senegal trails Group B leaders by two points and has little margin for error if they aim to avoid failure to make the 2026 World Cup.
